title: Research and Development Specialist at the ADA Chair in Financial Law (inclusive finance)
job_description: The Department of Law of the Faculty of Law, Economics and Finance of the University of Luxembourg is looking for a Research and Development specialist to conduct research in law and regulation of Sustainable and Inclusive Finance and/or Financial Technologies (FinTech).Your Role.. The Research and Development specialist will be working under the supervision of Professor Zetzsche, the holder of the ADA Chair in Financial Law (inclusive finance). In particular, the R&D Specialist will assist in:Creating and updating international databases on legal developments and research relating to FinTech, RegTech, Sustainable Finance and/or Financial Inclusion.Work in the field of company, securities, investment and other type of financial law, as research support, co-author and/or as own researcher in the fields of research pursued at the ADA Chair.Collect data and prepare scientific and policy reports on research results.If the research and development specialist is interested in pursuing independent research and qualified to do so, Professor Zetzsche will support the admission to the PhD programme in law.Qualifications.. We are looking for a candidate with a Master degree in Law. In particular, the following requirements apply:Proven interest in FinTech, RegTech, Sustainable Finance and/or Inclusive FinanceSpecific interest in participating in research projects and first experience in research methodsCuriosity for old and new legal and regulatory challengesWillingness to work in teamsSkills in English, German and French; additional language is welcome.In Short.. Contract Type: Fixed Term Contract 12 MonthWork Hours: Part Time 32.0 Hours per WeekStarting date: As soon as possibleLocation: KirchbergJob Reference: UOL04601In particular, we offer:An international environmentOpportunity to work in a very productive research institutionCompetitive remunerationA large and international research network with opportunities to connect to research and policy institutions around the Globe.How to apply.. Applications should be submitted online and include:A motivation letterA detailed curriculum vitaeThe name, current position and relationship to the applicant, of one referee.We encourage early application.Please apply formally through the HR system. Applications by email will not be considered. The University of Luxembourg embraces inclusion and diversity as key values.
